title: Static Reviewer
platforms: Windows and Linux; on-Premises and in Cloud; Desktop, CLI and CI/CD & IDE plugin integration
note: Static Reviewer executes code checks according to the most relevant Secure Coding Standards for 40+ programming languages, using 1000+ built-in validation rules.

title: Blacklock
note: 14-day trial

title: Astra Security Suite
note: Paid Option Available

title: ScanTitan Vulnerability Scanner
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: Security For Everyone
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: ReconwithMe
note: Paid Option Available

title: Acunetix
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: APIsec
note: Free limited API Pen Test

title: AppCheck Ltd.
note: Free trial scan available

title: Arachni
note: Free for most use cases

title: Bearer
note: Map sensitive data flows and identify security risks such as unauthorized data flow, missing encryption, unauthorized access, and more.

title: beSECURE (formerly AVDS)
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: BlueClosure BC Detect
note: 2 week trial

title: Burp Suite
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: Contrast
note: Free (Full featured for 1 App)

title: Codiga
note: Codiga scans your code and find security, safety, design, performance and maintainability issues in your code at each push or pull request. It integrates with GitHub, GitLab and Bitbucket.

title: Deepfence ThreatMapper
note: Apache v2

title: GoLismero
note: GPLv2.0

title: HostedScan.com
note: Free Forever

title: ImmuniWeb
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: InsightVM
note: Free trial available

title: Indusface Web Application Scanning
note: Free trial available

title: K2 Security Platform
note: Free trial available

title: Mayhem for API
note: 30-day Free Trial

title: Nmmapper Tool Collections
note: Great Collection of Kali Tool hosted online

title: Nexpose
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: Nuclei
note: Fast and customisable vulnerability scanner based on simple YAML based DSL.

title: Probely
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: Psalm
note: Static code analysis for PHP projects, written in PHP.

title: Ride (REST JSON Payload fuzzer)
note: Apache 2

title: Snyk
note: Find, learn and fix vulnerabilities in open source dependencies, in your application code, in container images or insecure configurations in Terraform and Kubernetes.

title: Tinfoil Security
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: Websecurify Suite
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: Website Security Check
note: 20% off with OWASP20

title: w3af
note: GPLv2.0

title: Beagle Security
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: WPScan
note: Free options

title: Zed Attack Proxy
note: Apache-2.0

title: CloudDefense
note: CloudDefense DAST integrates with any CI/CD with just 1 line of code. It supports multiple authentication types. Perform deep DAST scans with ease.

title: APIsecurity.io Security Audit
note: online tool for OpenAPI / Swagger file static security analysis

title: Bandit
note: Bandit is a comprehensive source vulnerability scanner for Python

title: Brakeman
note: Brakeman is an open source vulnerability scanner specifically designed for Ruby on Rails applications

title: Dawnscanner
note: Dawnscanner is an open source security source code analyzer for Ruby, supporting major MVC frameworks like Ruby on Rails, Padrino, and Sinatra. It also works on non-web applications written in Ruby.

title: Deep Dive
note: Byte code analysis tool for discovering vulnerabilities in Java deployments (EAR, WAR, JAR).

title: Enlightn
note: Enlightn is a vulnerability scanner specifically designed for Laravel PHP applications that combines SAST, DAST, IAST and configuration analysis techniques to detect vulnerabilities.

title: FindBugs
note: Find bugs (including a few security flaws) in Java programs [Legacy - NOT  Maintained - Use SpotBugs (see other entry) instead]

title: FindSecBugs
note: A security specific plugin for SpotBugs that significantly improves SpotBugs's ability to find security vulnerabilities in Java programs. Works with the old FindBugs too.

title: Flawfinder
note: Scans C and C++.

title: GolangCI-Lint
note: A Go Linters aggregator - One of the Linters is [gosec (Go Security)](https://github.com/securego/gosec), which is off by default but can easily be enabled.

title: Google CodeSearchDiggity
note: Uses Google Code Search to identify vulnerabilities in open source code projects hosted by Google Code, MS CodePlex, SourceForge, Github, and more. The tool comes with over 130 default searches that identify SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), insecure remote and local file includes, hard-coded passwords, and much more.  *Essentially, Google CodeSearchDiggity provides a source code security analysis of nearly every single open source code project in existence – simultaneously.*

title: Graudit
note: Scans multiple languages for various security flaws. Basically security enhanced code Grep.

title: HCL AppScan CodeSweep - GitHub Action
note: Scan the new code on a push/pull request using a GitHub action. Findings are highlighted in the `Files Changed` view and details about the issue and mitigation steps can be found in the `Actions` page. Unrestricted usage allowed with a free trial account. The tool currently supports Python, Ruby, JS (Vue, React, Node, Angular, JQuery, etc), PHP, Perl, COBOL, APEX & a few more.

title: HCL AppScan CodeSweep - VS Code
note: This is the first Community edition version of AppScan. It is delivered as a VS Code plugin and scans files upon saving them. The results show the location of a finding, type and remediation advice. The tool currently supports Python, Ruby, JS (Node, Angular, JQuery, etc) , PHP, Perl, COBOL, APEX & a few more.

title: HuskyCI
note: HuskyCI is an open-source tool that orchestrates security tests inside CI pipelines of multiple projects and centralizes all results into a database for further analysis and metrics. HuskyCI can perform static security analysis in Python (Bandit and Safety), Ruby (Brakeman), JavaScript (Npm Audit and Yarn Audit), Golang (Gosec), and Java(SpotBugs plus Find Sec Bugs)

title: Insider CLI
note: A open source Static Application Security Testing tool (SAST) written in GoLang for Java Maven and Android), Kotlin (Android), Swift (iOS), .NET Full Framework, C#, and Javascript (Node.js).

title: LGTM
note: A free for open source static analysis service that automatically monitors commits to publicly accessible code in Bitbucket Cloud, GitHub, or GitLab. Supports C/C++, C\#, Go, Java, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python.

title: MobSF
note: Mobile Security Framework (MobSF) is an automated, all-in-one mobile application (Android/iOS/Windows) pen-testing, malware analysis and security assessment framework capable of performing static and dynamic analysis.

title: phpcs-security-audit
note: A set of PHP_CodeSniffer rules to finds flaws or weaknesses related to security in PHP and its popular CMS or frameworks. It currently has core PHP rules as well as Drupal 7 specific rules.

title: PMD
note: PMD scans Java source code and looks for potential code problems (this is a code quality tool that does not focus on security issues).

title: PreFast
note: PREfast is a static analysis tool that identifies defects in C/C++ programs. Last update 2006.

title: Progpilot
note: Progpilot is a static analyzer tool for PHP that detects security vulnerabilities such as XSS and SQL Injection.

title: Pyre
note: A performant type-checker for Python 3, that also has [limited security/data flow analysis](https://pyre-check.org/docs/pysa-basics.html) capabilities.

title: Security Code Scan
note: Static code analyzer for .NET. It will find SQL injections, LDAP injections, XXE, cryptography weakness, XSS and more.

title: Semgrep
note: Lightweight static analysis for many languages. Find bug variants with patterns that look like source code. No compilation needed to scan source code. Supports Go, Java, JavaScript, JSON,Python, TypeScript, and more.

title: ShiftLeft Scan
note: A free open-source DevSecOps platform for detecting security issues in source ode and dependencies. It supports a broad range of languages and CI/CD pipelines by bundling various open source scanners into the pipeline.

title: Sink Tank
note: Java byte code static code analyzer for performing source/sink (taint) analysis.

title: SonarQube
note: Scans source code for 15 languages for Bugs, Vulnerabilities, and Code Smells. SonarQube IDE plugins for Eclipse, Visual Studio, and IntelliJ provided by [SonarLint](https://www.sonarlint.org/).

title: VisualCodeGrepper (VCG)
note: Scans C/C++, C\#, VB, PHP, Java, PL/SQL, and COBOL for security issues and for comments which may indicate defective code. The config files can be used to carry out additional checks for banned functions or functions which commonly cause security issues.

title: VS Code OpenAPI (Swagger) Editor extension
note: Plugin to Microsoft Visual Studio Code that enables rich editing capabilities   for REST API contracts and also includes linting and Security Audit (static security analysis).

title: 42Crunch
note: REST API security platform that includes Security Audit (SAST), dynamic conformance scan, runtime protection, and monitoring.

title: Application Inspector
note: combines SAST, DAST, IAST, SCA, configuration analysis and other technologies, incl. unique abstract interpretation; has capability to generate test queries (exploits) to verify detected vulnerabilities during SAST analysis; Supported languages include: Java, C\#, PHP, JavaScript, Objective C, VB.Net, PL/SQL, T-SQL, and others.

title: Beyond Security beSOURCE
note: Static application security testing (SAST) used to be divorced from Code quality reviews, resulting in limited impact and value. beSOURCE addresses the code security quality of applications and thus integrates SecOps into DevOps.

title: BlueClosure BC Detect
note: Analyzes client-side JavaScript.

title: CAST AIP
note: Performs static and architectural analysis to identify numerous types of security issues. Supports over 30 languages. [AIP's security specific coverage is here](https://www.castsoftware.com/solutions/application-security/cwe#SupportedSecurityStandards).

title: Codacy
note: Offers security patterns for languages such as Python, Ruby, Scala, Java, JavaScript and more. Integrates with tools such as Brakeman, Bandit, FindBugs, and others. (free for open source projects)

title: CodeScan Cloud
note: A Salesforce focused, SaaS code quality tool leveraging SonarQube's OWASP  security hotspots to give security visibility on Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning proprietary languages.

title: CodeSonar
note: tool that supports C, C++, Java and C\# and maps against the OWASP top 10 vulnerabilities.

title: Contrast Assess
note: Contrast performs code security without actually doing static analysis. Contrast does Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST), correlating runtime code & data analysis. It provides code level results without actually relying on static analysis.

title: CxSAST
platforms: Saas, or on-premises. Windows and Linux with CI/CD and IDE plugin integration
note: Run full or incremental source code security scans. Supported languages include Javascript, Java, Apex, PHP, Python, Swift, Scala, Perl, Groovy, Ruby, C++, C#.NET, PL/SQL, VB.NET, ASP.NET, HTML 5, Windows Mobile, Go, and Kotlin.

title: Fluid Attack's Scanner
note: SAST, DAST and SCA vulnerability detection tool with perfect OWASP Benchmark score.

title: DeepSource
note: DeepSource helps you automatically find and fix issues in your code during code reviews, such as bug risks, anti-patterns, performance issues, and security flaws. It takes less than 5 minutes to set up with your Bitbucket, GitHub, or GitLab account. It works for Python, Go, Ruby, and JavaScript.

title: DerScanner
note: Capable of identifying vulnerabilities and backdoors (undocumented features) in over 30 programming languages by analyzing source code or executables, without requiring debug info.

title: ECG
note: SaaS TCL Static Source Code Analysis Tool able to detect real and complex security vulnerabilities in TCL/ADP source-code. Discovered vulnerabilities will be mapped against the OWASP top 10 vulnerabilities.

title: Hdiv Detection
note: Hdiv performs code security without actually doing static analysis. Hdiv does Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST), correlating runtime code & data analysis. It provides code-level results without actually relying on static analysis.

title: Klocwork
note: Static Code Analysis for C, C++, C#, and Java

title: Kiuwan
note: provides an application security  testing and analytics platform –    including SAST and SCA solutions – that reduces risk and  improves change management and DevOps processes

title: Parasoft Test
note: Test tools for C/C++, .NET, Java

title: PITSS.CON
note: Scans Oracle Forms and Reports Applications

title: PT Application Inspector
note: Combines SAST, DAST, IAST, SCA, configuration analysis and other technologies for high accuracy. Can generate special test queries (exploits) to verify detected vulnerabilities during SAST analysis. Supports Java, C\#, PHP,  JavaScript, Objective C, VB.Net, PL/SQL, T-SQL, and others.

title: Puma Scan
note: A .NET C\# static source code analyzer that runs as a Visual Studio IDE extension, Azure DevOps extension, and Command Line (CLI) executable.

title: PVS-Studio Analyzer
note: Static code security analysis for C, C++, C#, and Java. A commercial B2B solution,  but provides several free [licensing options](https://www.viva64.com/en/b/0614/).

title: reshift
note: A CI/CD  static code security analysis tool for Java that uses machine learning to give a prediction on false positives.

title: RIPS Code Analysis
note: Static security analyzer for Java and PHP.

title: SecureAssist
note: Scans code for insecure coding and configurations automatically as an IDE plugin for Eclipse, IntelliJ, and Visual Studio, etc. Supports Java, .NET, PHP, and JavaScript.

title: ScanMyCode CE (Community Edition)
note: Code Scanning/SAST/Static Analysis/Linting using many tools/Scanners with One Report. Currently supports:  PHP, Java, Scala, Python, Ruby, Javascript, GO, Secret Scanning, Dependency Confusion, Trojan Source, Open Source and Proprietary Checks (total ca. 1000 checks). Supports also Differential analysis. Goal is to have one report using many tools/scanners

title: Sentinel Source
note: Static security analysis for 10+ languages.

title: Seeker
note: Seeker performs code security without actually doing static analysis. Seeker does Interactive Application Security Testing (IAST), correlating runtime code & data analysis with simulated attacks. It provides code level results without actually relying on static analysis.

title: Thunderscan SAST
note: Static security analysis for 27+ languages.

title: Oversecured
note: Enterprise vulnerability scanner for Android and iOS apps. It offers app owners and developers the ability to secure each new version of a mobile app by integrating Oversecured into the development process.

title: OWASP Code Crawler
note: .NET, Java

title: OWASP Orizon Project
note: Java

title: OWASP LAPSE Project
note: Java

title: OWASP WAP (Web Application Protection)
note: PHP

title: Agnitio
note: ASP, ASP.NET, C\#, Java, Javascript, Perl, PHP, Python, Ruby, VB.NET, XML

title: DevBug
note: PHP

title: SpotBugs
note: Java. This is the active fork replacement for FindBugs, which is not maintained anymore. Very little security. FindSecBugs plugin provides security rules.

title: Find Security Bugs
note: Java, Scala, Groovy

title: Microsoft FxCop
note: .NET

title: MobSF
note: Android Java, Objective C, Swift

title: .NET Security Guard
note: .NET, C\#, VB.net

title: nodejsscan
note: Node.js

title: Microsoft PREFast
note: C, C++

title: SonarCloud
note: ABAP, C, C++, Objective-C, COBOL, C\#, CSS, Flex, Go, HTML, Java, Javascript, Kotlin, PHP, PL/I, PL/SQL, Python, RPG, Ruby, Swift, T-SQL, TypeScript, VB6, VB, XML

title: Splint
note: C

title: Spectral
note: Discover, classify, and protect your codebases, logs, and other assets. Monitor and detect API keys, tokens, credentials, high-risk security misconfiguration and more.

title: VisualCodeGrepper
note: C/C++, C\#, VB, PHP, Java, PL/SQL

title: Fortify
note: Free trial scan available. Supported languages include: ABAP/BSP, ActionScript/MXML (Flex), APEX, ASP.NET, VB.NET, C\# (.NET), C/C++, Classic ASP (w/VBScript), COBOL, ColdFusion CFML, Go, HTML, Java (including Android), JavaScript/AJAX, JSP, Kotlin, Objective-C, PHP, PL/SQL, Python, Typescript, T-SQL, Ruby, Scala, Swift, Visual Basic (VB.NET), Visual Basic 6, VBScript, XML

title: Veracode
note: Android, ASP.NET, C\#, C, C++, Classic ASP, COBOL, ColdFusion/Java, Go, Groovy, iOS, Java, JavaScript, Perl, PhoneGap/Cordova, PHP, Python, React Native, RPG, Ruby on Rails, Scala, Titanium, TypeScript, VB.NET, Visual Basic 6, Xamarin

title: CodeSonar
note: C, C++, Java

title: ParaSoft
note: C, C++, Java, .NET

title: HCL AppScan on Cloud
note: Apex, ASP, C, C++, COBOL, ColdFusion, Go, Java, JavaScript(Client-side JavaScript, Kotlin, NodeJS, and AngularJS), .NET (C#, ASP.NET, VB.NET), .NET Core, Perl, PHP, PL/SQL, Python, Ruby, T-SQL, Swift, Visual Basic 6

title: HCL AppScan Source
note: Android, Apex, ASP, C, C++, COBOL, ColdFusion, Go, Java, JavaScript(Client-side JavaScript, NodeJS, and AngularJS), .NET (C#, ASP.NET, VB.NET), .NET Core, Perl, PHP, PL/SQL, Python, Ruby, T-SQL, Visual Basic 6

title: Coverity
note: Android, C\#, C, C++, Java, JavaScript, Node.js, Objective-C, PHP, Python, Ruby, Scala, Swift, VB.NET

title: Puma Scan Professional
note: .NET, C\#

title: Klocwork
note: C, C++, C\#, Java

title: Polyspace Static Analysis
note: C, C++, Ada

title: NextGen Static Analysis
note: Free version available. Currently supports Java, JavaScript, C\#, TypeScript, Python, and Terraform. Create your free account at https://shiftleft.io/register.

title: Kroogal
note: C, C++

title: Horusec
note: Python(3.x), Ruby, Javascript, GoLang, .NetCore(3.x), Java, Kotlin, Terraform

title: OWASP ASST (Automated Software Security Toolkit)
note: An Open Source, Source Code Scanning Tool, developed with JavaScript (Node.js framework), Scans for PHP & MySQL Security Vulnerabilities According to OWASP Top 10 and Some other OWASP's famous vulnerabilities, and it teaches developers of how to secure their codes after scan.

title: purpleteam
note: GNU-AGPL v3

title: Nucleaus Core
note: Scans Git repos daily and provides a web-based dashboard to track code and dependency vulnerabilities. Handles team-based access patterns, vulnerability exception lifecycle, and is built on API first principles.

title: Xanitizer
note: A SAST tool for Java, Scala, and JavaScript/TypeScript, mainly via taint analysis. Per this pricing page, it is free for Open Source projects if you contact the vendor.

title: CoGuard
note: A SAST tool for infrastructure configuration analysis. Support for common web servers, databases, streaming services, authentication services, container orchestration and Infrastructure-as-Code tools.

title: IOTHREAT
note: Free (View Partial Results). Full report (PRO) - 50% discount for the OWASP community with 'OWASP50'.

title: Offensive360
note: SAST technology that attacks the source code from all corners it has all in one. Malware, SCA, License, and deep source code analysis.

title: GitGuardian — Automated Secrets Detection
note: Secure your software development with automated secrets detection & remediation for private or public source code.

title: CloudDefense
note: CloudDefense provides holistic threat intelligence across all attack surfaces - Containers, Kubernetes, Code, Open Source Libraries, APIs and more...

title: clj-holmes
note: A CLI SAST (Static application security testing) tool which was built with the intent of finding vulnerable Clojure code via rules that use a simple pattern language.

title: OpenVAS by Greenbone
note: Open source full-featured vulnerability scanner, developed and maintained by Greenbone Networks GmbH.

title: SmartScanner
note: Free (Limited Capability)

title: ThreatMapper
note: Open source vulnerability discovery and prioritization for Kubernetes, Docker, Serverless and host-based workloads

title: SecretScanner
note: Find secrets (tokens, keys, passwords, etc) in containers and filesystems, supporting approx 140 different secret types

title: GitHub Advanced Security
note: GitHub Advanced Security uses CodeQL for Static Code Analysis, and GitHub Secret Scanning for identifying tokens. GitHub code scanning can import SARIF from any other SAST tool
